metro.WindowControls

Class List

  • java.lang.Object
    • metro.WindowControls.ActionObservable
      • metro.WindowControls.List
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ControlElement

    public class List
extends ActionObservable
implements ControlElement
    Creates a list control element that can have some entries in it. An entry is highlighted when the mouse is over it.
    Author:
    hauke

      • List

        public List(java.awt.Rectangle position,
    Window win)
        Creates a new list control element on a window.
        Parameters:
        position - The position on the window.
        win - The window with which this list of connected.

      • List

        public List(java.awt.Rectangle position,
    Window win,
    boolean compact)
        Creates a new list control element on a window.
        Parameters:
        position - The position on the window.
        win - The window with which this list of connected.
        compact - Set to true if list should be a compact list (entries are not that high)

      • List

        public List(java.awt.Rectangle position,
    java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> entries,
    Window win)
        Creates a new list control element on a window with some entries in it.
        Parameters:
        position - The position on the window.
        entries - The entries that are in the list after creating it.
        win - The window with which this list of connected.

      • List

        public List(java.awt.Rectangle position,
    java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> entries,
    Window win,
    boolean compact)
        Creates a new list control element on a window with some entries in it.
        Parameters:
        position - The position on the window.
        entries - The entries that are in the list after creating it.
        win - The window with which this list of connected.
        compact - Set to true if list should be a compact list (entries are not that high)

    • Method Detail

      • calcOffset

        private void calcOffset()
        Calculates the maximum offset for the list to scroll. If there're to less elements for scrolling the maximum offset is 0.

      • addElement

        public void addElement(java.lang.String element)
        Adds an element to the list control.
        Parameters:
        element - The element to add.

      • setState

        public void setState(boolean enableState)
        Description copied from interface: ControlElement
        Sets the enable state of the control. If it's disabled, the user can't interact with this control.
        Specified by:
        setState in interface ControlElement
        Parameters:
        enableState - The new state of the control.

      • getText

        public java.lang.String getText(int entryIndex)
        Gets the text of a given entry.
        Parameters:
        entryIndex - The number of the entry.
        Returns:
        String The text of the entry. It's "" if the entry doesn't exist.

      • getText

        public java.lang.String getText()
        Returns the text of the selected entry of this list. When the entry does not exists or nothing is selected an empty string will be returned.
        Returns:
        The text of the selecting entry. "" when selection is invalid.

      • setSelectedEntry

        public void setSelectedEntry(int entryIndex)
        Sets the selected Entry to a specific.
        Parameters:
        entryIndex - The entry number.

      • getSelected

        public int getSelected()
        Return the index of the selected entry.
        Returns:
        Index of selected entry. Returns -1 if nothing is selected.

      • getIndex

        public int getIndex(java.lang.String entryText)
        Returns the index of the first entry with the given text.
        Parameters:
        entryText - The text to search.
        Returns:
        The index. Returns -1 if the entry doesn't exist.

      • remove

        public void remove(int entryIndex)
        Removes the entry at this position.
        Parameters:
        entryIndex - The position of the entry.

      • contains

        public boolean contains(java.lang.String text)
        Checks if the given text is in the list.
        Parameters:
        text - The entry to search.
        Returns:
        True when the text is in the list, false if not.
